snippet: Using inexpensive digital technology, movie directors in Cuba are laying the foundations for an industry independent of the state apparatus of the Castro years.
abstract: Inexpensive digital technology is allowing Cuban filmmakers to work outside the state apparatus that has defined their country's cinema for much of the Castro era and their independent films are gaining prominence on the national and international scene.
lead_paragraph: Using inexpensive digital technology, movie directors in Cuba are laying the foundations for an industry independent of the state apparatus of the Castro years.

headline.seo: Digital Technology Is Making Its Mark in Cuba
headline.main: A New Era’s Filmmakers Find Their Way in Cuba
headline.print_headline: A New Era’s Filmmakers Find Their Way in Cuba
